channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Drone photo winners will amaze your eyeballs: From a high-up horseman to a holy river
item.description: The dazzling aerial photos honored by the 2025 Siena awards offer "new ways of seeing familiar places," as one judge puts it.
item.content:encoded:
The dazzling aerial photos honored by the 2025 Siena awards offer "new ways of seeing familiar places," as one judge puts it.

(Image credit: Dennis Schmelz)
item.dc:creator: Kamala Thiagarajan

item.title: Opinion: Ask your doctor if the World Series is right for you...
item.description: Prescription drug ads were once banned on broadcasts. But companies argued that infringed on free speech, and the drugs could help people. The FDA now permits pharmaceutical ads.
item.content:encoded: Prescription drug ads were once banned on broadcasts. But companies argued that infringed on free speech, and the drugs could help people. The FDA now permits pharmaceutical ads.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: A report claims left-wing terrorism is rising. The data paints a complicated picture
item.description: The report's claim comes with caveats. Its critics say it does more to reveal issues around collecting and analyzing domestic terrorism data than it does to clarify the current state of the problem.
item.content:encoded:
The report's claim comes with caveats. Its critics say it does more to reveal issues around collecting and analyzing domestic terrorism data than it does to clarify the current state of the problem.

(Image credit: Jacek Boczarski)
item.dc:creator: Odette Yousef

item.title: In the rural South where Medicaid has been a lifeline, residents brace for cuts
item.description: With Medicaid cutbacks on the horizon, millions in the U.S. are expected to go uninsured. In the Mississippi Delta region — one of the poorest places in the U.S. — people are stressed and mad.
item.content:encoded:
With Medicaid cutbacks on the horizon, millions in the U.S. are expected to go uninsured. In the Mississippi Delta region — one of the poorest places in the U.S. — people are stressed and mad.  

(Image credit: Shalina Chatlani)
item.dc:creator: Shalina Chatlani

item.title: What are your unique holiday traditions? NPR wants to know
item.description: The holiday season is full of traditions and we all celebrate them a bit differently. NPR wants to your most unique holiday traditions. What makes celebrating this time of year feel special for you?
item.content:encoded:
The holiday season is full of traditions and we all celebrate them a bit differently. NPR wants to your most unique holiday traditions. What makes celebrating this time of year feel special for you?

(Image credit: Stephanie Keith)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: 3 culinary tricks that might get you to eat more veggies, according to chef Roy Choi
item.description: Chef Roy Choi, known for his Korean-Mexican fusion food trucks, focuses on veggie-forward dishes in a new cookbook. He shares techniques to get you excited about your greens, plus 3 flavorful sauces.
item.content:encoded:
The Choi of Cooking: Flavor-Packed, Rule-Breaking Recipes for a Delicious Life, which he co-wrote with Tien Nguyen and Natasha Phan. This dish uses the Sweet Garlic Teriyaki Sauce you can find below.'/>

Chef Roy Choi, known for his Korean-Mexican fusion food trucks, focuses on veggie-forward dishes in a new cookbook. He shares techniques to get you excited about your greens, plus 3 flavorful sauces.

(Image credit: Bobby Fisher)
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: Trade tensions hang over Trump's Asia trip, but he still aims to make a deal
item.description: President Trump plans to attend a summit in Malaysia before meeting the new Japanese prime minister in Tokyo and talking to Chinese President Xi Jinping in Korea.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump plans to attend a summit in Malaysia before meeting the new Japanese prime minister in Tokyo and talking to Chinese President Xi Jinping in Korea.

(Image credit: Yoan Valat/Pool)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Blue Jays rout Dodgers 11-4 in World Series opener
item.description: Addison Barger launched the first pinch-hit grand slam in World Series history, as the Toronto Blue Jays overwhelmed the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers in the opener Friday night in Toronto.
item.content:encoded:
Addison Barger launched the first pinch-hit grand slam in World Series history, as the Toronto Blue Jays overwhelmed the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers in the opener Friday night in Toronto.

(Image credit: David J. Phillip)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: U.S. sends aircraft carrier to South America in major escalation of military firepower
item.description: The deployment and the quickening pace of U.S. strikes, including one Friday, raised new speculation about how far the Trump administration may go in operations it says are targeted at drug trafficking.
item.content:encoded:
The deployment and the quickening pace of U.S. strikes, including one Friday, raised new speculation about how far the Trump administration may go in operations it says are targeted at drug trafficking.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: DOJ hires immigration judges after months of layoffs
item.description: Judges will soon take the bench across 16 states, the Justice Department said. These include courts that saw the biggest losses of judges this year.
item.content:encoded:
Judges will soon take the bench across 16 states, the Justice Department said. These include courts that saw the biggest losses of judges this year.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo
